intro: Fedorovia, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs characterized by their small, often clustered flowers and evergreen foliage. The plants typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are native to regions in Africa, Asia, and Australia. Fedorovia species are known for their ornamental value, with showy blooms that range in color from white to pink and purple. They are generally low-maintenance and thrive in well-drained conditions.
